channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for KS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for KS

item.title: Report X-2024031338
item.description:
Report X-2024031338

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-29T18:14:08+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: While a package handler was unloading a trailer, he noticed that a package was leaking and he told his manger. DescribePack: the contents got loose cap and spilled out like one gallon in total. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The manage called QA, QA went to the area and clean the spilled and brought the packaged in a tote line with a hazmat bag.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A LEAKING HAZMAT WAS FOUND ON THE UNLOAD AREA. THE RESPONDER REFERED TO THEIR DECISION TREE AND PLACED THE LEAKING PACKAGE IN A LINED SPILL TUB. CLEANED UP THE SPILL AND MOVED THE PACKAGE TO THE DMP AREA FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2024031268
item.description:
Report X-2024031268

  • City: LENEXA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: SequenceEvent: MANAGER NOTICED THE PACKAGE WAS LEAKING IN THE CHUTE AND NOTIFIED QA. QA PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED TOTE AND CLEANED UP THE SPILL. THE PACKAGE WAS THEN TAKEN TO THE PROCESSING CAGE. DescribePack: BOTH OF THE BOTTLES WERE LEAKING OUT FROM AROUND THE CAPS AND SOILED THE BOX. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A LINED TOTE.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was discovered while unloading a trailer. It was reported to QA by the manager. It was recovered and brought to the processing cage. DescribePack: The liquids leaked through a loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The spill was cleaned with absorb-all and the package was placed in a tote with a liner.

item.title: Report E-2024030473
item.description:
Report E-2024030473

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-22
  • City: KANSAS CITY
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal XKC experienced a UN3266 Flash Clene 1414 release from a 330-gallon poly tote. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 0.5 cup of product released to a 1’ x 1’ area of the poly tote body due to a crack on the top corner of the tote. The material was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with absorbents, pads, and PPE into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report I-2024020006
item.description:
Report I-2024020006

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-27T15:12:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-18
  • City: SALINA
  • State: KS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: HIGH PRESSURE TRANSPORTS LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Our truck and trailer was getting washed at Blue Beacon in Salina, KS. During the wash, one of the valves must have been accidentally turned or hit causing the line to fill up with vapor and then come out of the top of the trailer. After the release was noticed the employees stepped outside as the driver moved the truck and trailer outside. When the driver got outside he went back to trying to fix the trailer until the release had stopped.
